DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study : 1 . To assess effect BOTOX injection scalene muscle severity pain TOS . 2 . To assess effect BOTOX injection numbness tingle quality life .
DOC.brief_title: Treatment Thoracic Outlet Syndrome ( TOS ) With Botox
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Thoracic Outlet Syndrome ( TOS ) symptom complex consist pain , paresthesias often functional impairment cause compression neurovascular supply upper limb . Impingement may occur interscalene triangle , anesthetic blockade chemodenervation scalene muscle show temporarily improve symptom TOS non-randomized control trial . Objective : To assess effect Botulinum Toxin Type A ( BTX-A ) injection scalene muscle pain , paresthesias function subject TOS . Hypothesis : BTX-A injected anterior middle scalene muscle reduce irritation neurovascular structure interscalene triangle subject TOS . This lead reduction pain paresthesia , improvement function compare injection placebo . Intervention : Each subject receive injection EMG guidance anterior middle scalene muscle either 75 unit BTX-A ( experimental group ) , normal saline ( control group ) . Both group provide stretch strengthen exercise program .
DOC.criteria: Age least 19 year Medically stable Able give inform consent Meets criteria clinical diagnosis TOS Symptoms TOS present least six month Have EMG study CT MRI scan cervical spine Prior treatment BTXA Allergy BTXA History botulinum toxicity Prior scalenectomy Surgery TOS plan within six month Use blood thinner , i.e. , warfarin ; unfractionated low molecular weight heparin History Myasthenia Gravis , EatonLambert Syndrome ShyDrager Syndrome Unable complete followup assessment 6 week , 3 month 6 month Any abnormality EMG , CT MRI study suggest alternate diagnosis Pregnancy plan pregnancy within six month
